intro: Brachystegia mpalensis, commonly known as the African brachystegia, is a deciduous tree native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and dense, rounded crown. The tree typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in miombo woodlands. It produces small, white flowers followed by woody pods containing seeds. Brachystegia mpalensis plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
